DataElement.preferredName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Clinical Tumor T Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary intrahepatic bile duct carcinoma based on information obtained from the date of cancer diagnosis until the start of definitive treatment, or within four months (whichever is shorter), using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Neoplasm Clinical T Category
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The bile ducts which are located within the liver. They include the small interlobular bile ducts, intrahepatic large bile ducts, and the intrahepatic portions of the left and right hepatic ducts._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The bile ducts which are located within the liver. They include the small interlobular bile ducts, intrahepatic large bile ducts, and the intrahepatic portions of the left and right hepatic ducts.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Concepts.definition: The bile ducts which are located within the liver. They include the small interlobular bile ducts, intrahepatic large bile ducts, and the intrahepatic portions of the left and right hepatic ducts.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8-30-19 tmt released.; 12/12/18 tmt created for standardization.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 T Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of intrahepatic bile duct cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This staging system applies to intrahepatic cholangiocarcinomas, combined hepatocellular-cholangiocarcinomas (mixed hepatocholangiocarcinomas), and primary neuroendocrine tumors of the liver. Primary sarcomas of the liver, pure hepatocellular carcinomas, hilar cholangiocarcinomas, and gallbladder carcinomas are not staged using this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intrahepatic bile duct cancer with tumor involving local extrahepatic structures by direct invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Intrahepatic bile duct cancer with tumor involving local extrahepatic structures by direct invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intrahepatic bile duct cancer with tumor perforating the visceral peritoneum. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Intrahepatic bile duct cancer with tumor perforating the visceral peritoneum. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intrahepatic bile duct cancer with solitary tumor with intrahepatic vascular invasion, or multiple tumors, with or without vascular invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Intrahepatic bile duct cancer with solitary tumor with intrahepatic vascular invasion, or multiple tumors, with or without vascular invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pT1b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pT1b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intrahepatic bile duct cancer with solitary tumor larger than 5 cm without vascular invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pT1b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Intrahepatic bile duct cancer with solitary tumor larger than 5 cm without vascular invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pT1a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pT1a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intrahepatic bile duct cancer with solitary tumor equal to or less than 5 cm without vascular invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pT1a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Intrahepatic bile duct cancer with solitary tumor equal to or less than 5 cm without vascular invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intrahepatic bile duct cancer with solitary tumor equal to or less than 5 cm, or larger than 5 cm without vascular invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Intrahepatic bile duct cancer with solitary tumor equal to or less than 5 cm, or larger than 5 cm without vascular invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pTis TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pTis TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intrahepatic bile duct cancer with a finding of carcinoma in situ (intraductal tumor). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pTis TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Intrahepatic bile duct cancer with a finding of carcinoma in situ (intraductal tumor). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intrahepatic bile duct cancer with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Intrahepatic bile duct cancer with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intrahepatic bile duct cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Intrahepatic bile duct cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
